definition: (Confucianism) rites and music (the means of regulating society)
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
see 禮崩樂壞|礼崩乐坏[li3 beng1 yue4 huai4]

sentences.english: Esthetically, its nucleus is the relationship between ideal and friendliness.
sentences.chinese: 從美學角度研究禮樂，它的核心是美與善的關係。

sentences.english: Taoist ritual is actually a successor civilization.
sentences.chinese: 道教實際上是禮樂文明的繼承者。

sentences.english: Lile says that he favors carry on peace pipe.
Briefly speaking, Confucius' esthetics is that of ceremonial rites and music.
sentences.chinese: 孔子的美學概而言之就是禮樂美學。

sentences.english: The second point is that the system changes redquin destiny view of Han people and music system in the comments.
sentences.chinese: 二爲漢代人天命觀和禮樂制度的變化在註解中的體現。

sentences.english: Confucius is the founder of Confucian musical ideology.
sentences.chinese: 孔子是儒家禮樂思想的奠基人。

sentences.english: The ritual and musical instruments in the Shang and Zhou period embodied the institution of rites and music.
sentences.chinese: 商周時期，禮器和樂器是禮樂制度的物化形態。

sentences.english: The rise and decline of the culture of Zhou Dynasty can explain the both courses.
sentences.chinese: 詩意流變的過程是與周代禮樂文化的興衰相始終的。

sentences.english: The Zhou Dynasty was the period which the Rite-music Culture had the most celebrated stage.
sentences.chinese: 周代是我國曆史上禮樂文化最鼎盛的時期。

sentences.english: The ultimate goal was to make the ceremony to be complemented.
sentences.chinese: 禮樂相輔最終的目的是爲了使“禮”得以實現。

sentences.english: Hence filial piety is combined with rituals as Pietyrite which serves as the logic origin of the culture.
sentences.chinese: 孝與禮相結合而爲孝禮，是禮樂文化的邏輯起點。

definition: a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
saint/sage/refers to Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]/the current reigning Emperor

the Five Classics of Confucianism, namely: the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1], the Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], and the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1]
the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1] and the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

the Confucian Six Arts, namely: rites or etiquette 禮|礼[li3] (禮儀|礼仪[li3 yi2]), music 樂|乐[yue3] (音樂|音乐[yin1 yue4]), archery 射[she4] (射箭[she4 jian4]), charioteering 御[yu4] (駕車|驾车[jia4 che1]), calligraphy or literacy 書|书[shu1] (識字|识字[shi2 zi4]), mathematics or reckoning 數|数[shu4] (計算|计算[ji4 suan4])/another name for the Six Classics 六經|六经[Liu4 jing1]
